fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A report mischaracterised the role of Scotland’s police complaints body (CCTV footage prompts call to investigate man’s death during 2015 arrest, 19 December, page 25). The Police Investigations and Review Commissioner does not recommend potential disciplinary action against officers, as we indicated; rather its role is to gather evidence and make findings. We should have reported that it made no findings that supported or justified legal action against the officers involved. • Other recently corrected articles include: Kingsley Burrell family call for inquiry after sacking of police officer Environment, Jaffa Cakes and Kylie Jenner star in statistics of the year The dark history of Santa’s city: how Rovaniemi rose from the ashes Legal plastic content in animal feed could harm human health, experts warn
